page.title: 12HOUSING 2
page.content: the old stone has been hidden under harling. Such modernisation has not, unfortunately, been in keeping with the environment. In contrast the new houses have been built of concrete blocks then rendered and harled with roofs of man made tiles;their windows are large (picture) and doubled-glazed; chimneys are an exception. The above reflects the changes that have taken place both n this block and adjacent ones. Changes in farming have seen not only grearer properity but also both the amalgamation of farms and the reduction in the workforce so farmhouses and cottages have been sold. The rapid increase in the population and the greater prosperity due to industrial development meant that many people could afford to own their own homes and chose to do so rat
